audio_description: Today we’ll see a superb Kerala-style mutton biryani recipe. In this Malabar-style biryani, first the mutton is well cooked with a gravy, then the rice is fried, and finally both are layered and cooked on dum to make a delicious mutton biryani.

Adding grated coconut to the rice

Adding cooked meat to the pot
Adding fried onions to the curry mixture

Adding jeera rice to the pot
Adding fresh mint leaves to the pot
Adding coriander leaves to the pot
Adding green chili to the pot

Removing the lid to check the rice

audio_description: Let’s see how tasty Malabar biryani is made. First, we take a pressure cooker and add 750 grams of mutton. Then we add whole spices, pepper powder, garam masala, and salt. Mix everything well and cook the mutton.

audio_description: We had fried some onions earlier for garnish, so now we’ll add those birista onions. Since we pressure-cooked the mutton earlier, it’s already soft. We won’t cook it more, just mix and let it rest.

audio_description: To prepare the rice, heat a pot, add ghee and oil, then add half an onion and sauté well. Add cumin seeds, and now add the jeerakasala rice (small-grain aromatic rice), about half a kilogram.
